item.title: Lennart Poettering
item.description: So, if you ask me what my takeaway from the Crowdstrike issue is, I'd say: boot counting/boot assessment/automatic fallback should really be a MUST for today's systems. *Before* you invoke your first kernel you need have tracking of boot attempts and a logic for falling back to older versions automatically. It's a major shortcoming that this is not default behaviour of today's distros, in particular commercial ones.Of course systemd has supported this for a long time:https://systemd.io/AUTOMATIC_BOOT_ASSESSMENT/

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: Justice delayed is justice denied? An(other) example of the utility of PubPeer's early-warning role.Published in 2011, questioned in 2013, "corrected" in 2016, retracted in 2024. The retraction like the correction studiously avoids asking the question: "how did that happen?" See the rotations in comment #5.If a paper can be evaluated for publication in two weeks, then maybe it should be possible to reconsider its publication in fewer than 11 years?https://pubpeer.com/publications/0EE74C4141AE8E5B960856232E8F8E#5

item.title: Mastodon Migration
item.description: Just got off the line with both millennial daughters who last week were completely checked out on politics even considering the stakes of this election. Both gave hundreds to Kamala Harris yesterday, and are looking for ways to get involved in the campaign. They were energized and in tears with hope for the future. What had seemed to them like an inevitable descent into a dystopian fascism is now a fight for a better more democratic future. The change in attitude is impossible to overstate.

item.title: myrmepropagandist
item.description: They had the signs printed in advanced. Hired a graphic designer. (Wow he did a good job.) Handed them out. Waved them proudly on television. Like they say "Lower Taxes" or something. There is no neutral way to read this sign. It's about getting rid of people because of who they are. There is no gray area. No fig leaf. Just eliminationism. It doesn't even say WHO or WHY.
